intro: Aegiphila luschnathii, commonly known as Luschnath's aegiphila, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and culinary uses. The plant features aromatic, hairy leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Aegiphila luschnathii is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats.
